column1:
Even though the actual apt listed was not ready due to a renovation delay, Jia was gracious and nice enough to let us stay in her own apt, which turned out to be very large, nice and comfortable place. We felt very much at home and had a great time. My husband and I were there for the World Expo so we, unfortunately, didn't get a chance to explore the neighborhood as much as we liked, but it of what we saw, we really liked. 

My only complaint is that the apartment we stayed in was in a very residential area and the walk to the subway was a bit far. Taxis are very affordable, but sometimes difficult to find a free one. Of course this might not pertain to the actual apt Jia has listed, which, I think, is located closer to the subway. 

Overall, Jia was a great host. She was very accommodating, helpful and made us feel very welcomed. She helped us order a taxi on our last day and even introduced us to local Chinese teas and fruits as well. :) I would highly recommend her!

Jia's place is in a vibrant and (in my opinion!) the most beautiful section of Shanghai. The French Concession is known for its leafy streets lined with cafes, boutique shops, upscale spas, yoga studios, and art galleries. Shanghai__ nickname as the __aris of the East_ evidently stems from the tree-lined avenues, Tudor mansions and French-influence architecture of this district. Exploring every alley of this graceful district would likely take a long time, and the constant renewal process that occurs in Shanghai insures that the urban landscape will likely be quite different in a few years than what it offers today. In particular I liked the area just north of Huaihai Rd, as Fenyang Rd. turns into Donghu Rd. Within a 10-minute walk you have your choice of dozens of upscale delicious ethnic restaurants and it is less than a 10-minute walk to Changshu Rd. subway station. Centrally located within Puxi, the center of Shanghai, you couldn't ask for a more convenient location. One thing I really like about Jia's apartment is that music can be heard from all corners of the apartment complex. Just next door a junior high school student practiced the violin for hours upon hours a day. Across the courtyard, there was the sound of a saxophone, and around the corner someone practiced Chinese folk songs on a dizi. This really enchanted my daily life. Since the apartment is just around the corner from the Shanghai Conservatory of Music, the entire area is packed with music shops selling scores, CDs, and instruments. The apartment is not large but clean, well-appointed, and gets great light. I really enjoyed washing my laundry and hanging it out to air-dry on bamboo poles like my Chinese neighbors! Make sure you you use clips though, or your clothes will fall down to the 1st floor garden apartment! The friendly security guard had to help me retrieve my clothes. The apartment is in a very safe area and is constantly under surveillance by a security guard. Although it is always a good idea to lock your windows in any large city, it is unlikely that a thief could enter this complex unnoticed. At night, a large gate to the complex is closed to prevent traffic from entering and guests must check in with a security guard. Although Fuxing Rd. is busy and noisy, the apartment is set back from the main road so it is quiet and peaceful at night. There were a few minor maintenance issues with the apartment during the time I was there, but Jia always responded promptly. Even when she couldn't come over herself, her adorable father would eagerly come over to help! I must admit that my body didn't react well at first to Shanghai and I was sick on and off for about two months, not to mention suffering somewhat from culture shock. Jia helped me more than once with medicine and the like and provided a compassionate ear. On more than one occasion she invited me...
The host canceled my reservation the day before arrival.
Very Nice Place, Convenient and Comfortable for Staying.

Very friendly host who was helpful and really tries to make our stay and enjoyable one. Great check-in and check-out time, and FANTASTIC location near two malls and a metro station with connections to 4 lines to take you around Shanghai.

The place is very neat and close to subway station. Xuexia prepared almost everything you need to stay comfortable. But one of the bedrooms is separated from the living room by a curtain. If you or your friend need more privacy or quieter sleeping surrounding, you probably need to take some consideration.

The transportation is very convenient. It's near the exit of the subway station. All three beds are good, and the kitchen and dining room are surprisingly large. The only fly in the ointment was that the neighborhood was a little old and the elevators were slow. But overall, it's recommended.
A nice apartment but quite noisy at night.

Address is very confusing, expect to contact the host to get to the apartment. Narrow staircase walk up to the unit, big luggage may not advisable. Water heater is tricky, you may not get the hot water consistently.
Nice apartment / communicative owner / just bedroom a bit cold in winter / recommend this place

Excellent location, and easy to access to nice local bars, cafes. Room is clean with chic style . It was pleasure to meet Liting and her friends. She showed me some nice local bars, and shopping district. She is a wonderful host and very easy going.

Liting is a charming girl she provides good recommendations for bars in the block and very easy to communicate with. 
The house__ location is perfect, next to Ferguson Lane, I think it__ the best place you can find in SH to spend your time. If you travel alone, I think you should try to live here. I have spent some good time, miles is cute,too
Excellent location.  Close to public transportation.   Fun neighborhood.  Liting was a gracious host.

Liting is a very nice and friendly host.
The room is bright and neat, with a comfy bed and air con, and the neighbourhood is great to have a walk or a coffee, and to dine out

Liting__ place is great! It is fully furnished and beautifully designed :) I enjoyed staying and meeting Liting & her lovely cats. Her place is located in cool neighborhood where you can see a lot of interesting cafes, bars and restaurants. I would definitely recommend her place to anyone who visit Shanghai! Thank you Liting.
Liting__ place is quite convenient in the French Concession. Easier to access. Thanks for the hospitality
Good host and convenient location! I do recommend to live in here!
At central Shanghai with convenient location.

#-________-
When you are old and grey
and full of sleep,
And nodding by the fire,
Take down this book,
And slowly read,
and dream of the soft look
Your eyes had once,
and of their shadows deep;

The host is a super elegant woman, her look, her style, her music, I just love love love everything about her! And her cats are adorable too! They are really close to people, which is rare;) as for the place, it__ actually a shared room. I didn__ notice that during booking. I gotta say it__ a little disappointing since I am the kinda person who values privacy and craves for staying all alone after a tiring day. Since it__ a shared house, that means you__l stay with the host. It__ inevitable to be not that clean, which bothers me a little but I really love the scent of the place and the hospitality of the cats ;) plus, I really love the songs that the host kept playing, really groovy!

Highly recommended for location - it was conveniently located in the French concession, and there were a lot of nice streets nearby to walk. Liting was also very friendly and made us feel very welcome.

Great location where there are a number of famous classical architectures. Comfortable stay in the typical Shanghai alley flat matched with the photos shot by the host. I hope to stay there next time.

Liting is a fantastic host, super helpful. Her home is great and the location is simply outstanding. You get what you see. Only thing - there is no elevator so you got to trek your luggage 3 floors.

Nice place!
It is clean, amenities are fine,  and near the Joaotong university station.  The owner of this room is sweet person:) It was very nice to talk with her.
And there are two cats. They are so much cute...They will surely bring you peace.

I found some convenience stores, a supermarket, and many coffee shops around there. 
The surrounding area is beautiful with tree-lined platanus trees. 
It is also suitable for taking pictures.

One point to keep in mind is that the apartment has no elevator. It__ be better not to choose this room if you don__ want to walk four flights up to the room.

Very nice and quiet neighborhood, easy access to 24 hour convenience store and a famous Shanghainese restaurant. Across street from a live jazz place. Walking distance to Jiaotong University subway station which has a direct link to Hongqiao Airport or Railway Station. The host is a nice and pretty girl. The downside is that the place has no elevator, it__ a pain to carry the luggage all the way upstairs and downstairs. In addition, it__ quite a surprise that the lock to the bedroom is broken, therefore the cats and the host can inadvertently break into the room which is quite a disturbance for me. The tiny kitchen is always messy that can use some cleaning. It__ not that desirable for any cooking there.
Had a lot of fun playing with her cats. Very friendly and showed me around

Liting is so nice and the room is wonderful! I've been Shanghai for many times but this time I felt really comfortable and satisfied.
Few minutes for walking to the subway station and bars nearby just make this place perfect.

Only stayed here for a couple days, I felt at home~ In my travel schedule I would love to have local experiences and make some new friends, and dear liting offered very considerate help and many tips in great restaurants and amazing art exhibitions while she knew I didn__ have much travel schedule. Cute cats, stylish place, convenient transportation, comfy corner at bedroom, __idnight dinner_ etc. The soup is not only of good taste, but also love from ting. So it deserves a five star coz exceed my expectations. Many thanks to this cutie pie and hope to see you again in Shanghai or Canton.
It's been a pleasant stay here in shanghai. Host is amazingly welcome and comforting. I will definitely recommend!!!
Probably the best air BNB experience I had the opportunity to live. Everything is perfect and the hosts are super nice. I strongly recommend.

Highly recommended!
The host is very friendly and enthusiastic. I lived here for two month during which I would always receive some dessert from the host including rice-pudding, cake, watermelon... whenever I met some issue, he would respond quickly and solve it patiently.
There is a lovely cat in the apartment that was always curious to enter my room and explore. (So cute)
As for the address, the nearby environment is quiet and peaceful. There are supermarkets nearby and the nearest shopping area is around 15 mins walk (5mins cycling). By the way, you can view the Oriental Pearl Tower at the rooftop of the apartment.

The room is about 1 km too far from the closes the metro station, but besides from that I am very happy with my stay. Jun, the host, was the best host I__ ever had, picking me up at the metro station, helping me with my big luggage, answering all of my questions, and even inviting me to have a meal with him and his wife. A wonderful experience. Would definitely stay her again despite the distance.
Great hospitality, clean room with lots of place, and a lovely family. I strongly recommend

Staying at Sean__ place is one of my best Airbnb experience, I have to say. 
Both of them two hosts are suuuuuuper nice and outgoing. Basically you could ask them for any help you need. And their interaction with kimi(the cat) is so lovely and kimi is our little baby. lol
The room is stylish and cozy. The home is tidy and warm. The cat kimi is my sweetheart. Every time I went back home and she would wait for me in the front of the gate. 
Definitely recommend!!!!

Okay let me think of something more to talk about...
The home has laundry devices and a large TV, a nice view of Shanghai skyline. I know the fact that Sean and junyi want to hear sweet words from me and they will feel extremely happy about that but I have to save my words cuz my trip still not end right now and I love them

While the host are really nice and helpful I don__ think the place is for tourist. It is very local in a old building where you will have to travel up to the sixth floor with your luggage in a stair case that__ pitch black. The pillows are too soft and bed is not that great however, one may could make it work if needed be. Please keep in mind that everyone shares one bathroom as I was confused a bit from the pictures. I decided to check out early and since we were on the 6th floor I had to take one bag down at a time, and got locked out the apartment. I missed my flight and had to wait all day to get my luggage as no one was home. I could not find the MTR station and did not feel safe in neighborhood.

This accommodation turned out to be much more than just a stylish place to stay in! Of course the design of the place caught my eyes in the first place, in real life it really looks likes a place popped out of (Hidden by Airbnb) , with great colors of green and gold. I especially like the bathtub in the bathroom. The location was awesome, it__ in a very local residential compound, but it__ actually in a quite hip area crowded with restaurants, bars, cafes and cool people. The shampoo, shower gel, and body lotion is of good quality, not something from some crappy convenient stores from across the street. It__ also equipped with speaker (Marshall!!! i always need to carry a small speaker with me when I travel, so this is insanely helpful to me!) and coffee machine (Nespresso). I lived by myself this time, but it has two bathrooms actually, both places have toilets and showers. And the sofa can also be used as a bed, and actually 4 people can live in this place. Overall, it__ been an awesome experience. Oh also, I think you can take some great photos for your friends in here too.

I had headaches choosing a good place to stay until I discovered this one in the French Concession. The location is so convenient - I literally just walked to brunch with my friends and we spent the whole afternoon wandering around small shopping stores across the streets. The interior of this suite relaxed me immediately when I walked in. I was also surprise by the high-quality amenities in the kitchen and bathrooms. The rooms were super clean, new and quite, completely different to some other old townhouse rooms I stayed in Shanghai. Highly recommend this place!
A place that__ makes you feel peace and quiet from the busy city. The color also gives people a very nice and cosy feeling.
2nd stay here. Definitely love this place!

This is a great place for anyone that wants to get a feel for one of Shanghai's coolest neighborhoods and avoid staying in a high rise hotel in the toursity part of town. Ryan's place offers amazing access to the Former French Concession's many restaurants and shops. The unit was  comfortable and spacious, and Ryan did a great job communicating with us throughout.
Comfortable and well appointed place in a really nice part of town.
Lovely place ,nice host ,cute dog near ,super nice !

We stayed here in An Fu Lu area in our time in China. Even paid a steep cancelation fee at another place to book this one and so glad we did. After visiting Xi__n and Beijing the first week of the trip, this was the third place we stayed. Hands down the best one! Very clean, you could smell it, very stylish, and just a great place. As a tourist, we didn__ know what to expect but this was awesome. Everything you could want is walkable and you feel very safe walking, even late at night. Great place, and a great host.

Located right at the heart of old French quarter.
Tastefully decorated with thoughtful touches.
Warm hospitality.
Great place that__ roomy and centrally located. Would definitely stay here again!
Location is good, lacks hot water, impossible to lock doors of bedrooms

Excellent! Lovely old Shanghai style apartment in downtown. 
Quite close to shopping mall and many famous restaurants.

A gorgeous stylish place, in the absolutely ideal location. Would be ideal for a couple to stay in, although it was ok for 2 friends sharing too. Loved the gorgeous dark green walls and parquet flooring. Communication and checkin was all super fast and easy. Highly recommend.
Great location and lovely area. Quick response from host.

Great host, quick in communication! I__l be back soon.

Great location! Super cute neighbor. We arrived early and the host let us check in early to leave our luggages. It was heavy pouring rain when we arrived, the host not only allowed us to borrow the two umbrellas so we can finish our tour of the city, also left us a bottle of red wine because the kitchen had a small leak which they promised to fix the next day. The host was super easy to communicate and respond very fast! I would recommend Din__ place to anyone!

Location is perfect! In the french concession and Anfu Li with lots of amenities, bars, restaurants, supermarket, bakery..Ryan was the perfect host! Responding quickly and checking in every few days if everything was fine. Main room was big and spacious! Enjoyed our stay overall

Very stylish designs and super nice location in the surroundings !
The host respond is quick ,friendly and helpful as well
Highly recommend for friends and couples stay
Wonderful home. You can stay comfortably!

Amazing experience, love the decor and the theme and the comfort level was so great we kinda didn__ want to leave the apartment, even if we were located in the heart of the French concession with all the great cafes, bars and restaurants within 200m of the apartment. Can__ complain about anything, except that the  stay was too short!

Host was very nice and friendly, and easy to communicate, although it had some issue of the Internet problem and one bathroom shower didn__ work at first but host did try his best to solve it. Room is nice and comfy in general. Excellent location to stay and enjoy the city life. Highly recommended.

We had a fantastic stay in Ryan__ apartment in Shanghai, it__ right in the middle of the French concession with bakeries and little shops around the corner. The design is super stylish can absolutely recommend staying here and would definitely come back

Kina is a really great host. The place is fantastic! Great decoration and old neighborhood will let you travel through the time. You can have unique local experience with traditional wet market which just step a way! I also enjoy the morning when you open the curtain, and the sunshine will spread through the tree into the house! I will definitely come back again when I visit Shanghai next time.
I've had such an amazing stay at Kina's place. She's so sweet and welcoming, the location is perfect and the flat is very clean!
One of the cutest places I have ever stayed on Airbnb! Kina was really kind and helpful.

I highly recommend staying here. The flat was much bigger than expected, all amenities are provided and the place was not just beautiful but also clean. Kina was a great host and communication was smooth and easy :)

Kina__ Place is a really nice flat in a calm and safe neighborhood. It is very nice and cozy and has everything one could wish for. It__ perfect for a couple of two! The location is easy to reach by Metro Line 8 which ist a good starting point to travel all around the city.
Also in walking distance, Changli Lu, on the way to the Expo Center has a los of wonderful tasty restaurants and a lovely nightmarket with a lot of small shops.
We would definitely recommend Kina__ apartment!

I__e stayed in many Airbnb__ around the world and Kina__ place was absolutely my favourite! It__ in a fairly central location and close to the metro station. Everything was very clean and all amenities were provided. We were also absolutely in love with the way the apartment was decorated and it felt very spacious! We definitely recommend Kina__ place to everyone but, keep in mind that it might not be most accessible for those who use wheelchairs or have many heavy luggages as there are a few flights of stairs. We had no issue with our stay despite having two large luggage ourselves. Thank you for a wonderful stay and we definitely will stay at Kina__ place again!

Communication with Kina was instantaneous; she was very quick to respond to all my questions. Check-in was extremely easy and fast. The building is older and there are no elevators, but it's a short walk up and the interior is very nicely renovated and decorated. It's located on the Pudong side in a very "local" area; we never saw any foreigners while walking around, so you really get the "local" experience. There's a ton of places to eat and many shops nearby, including a food court near the subway station that we frequented almost daily for breakfast! Kina also kindly provided a list of tips for Shanghai. Would recommend!

The house is clean and there__ no dust in house! The house is so stylish! Exactly the same look as the picture.
And the owner is with passion and carefully take care of us in Shanghai.

the apartment is exceptional! Kina and her friend are very responsive and have given us clear instructions to the location. we had a great time in the apartment. the only pitfall of the neighborhood is that there's a school nearby. considerable noise from the collective morning exercises at 8h

Kina's place is perfectly situated just outside the main city of Shanghai. A quick 5min walk gets you to the amazingly connected train system. 

The finishing touches really makes this place feel like a home. If that's not enough, Kina was one of the best hosts I have ever hard. From helping me with check in and directions, she made my first trip to China a breeze. Highly recommended.

We spent 1 month here and we enjoyed our stay a lot! Kina and YuWen are very kind and helpful hosts and their place makes you feel like at home! I love cooking and there__ a great local market close by, many small shops... A very good and authentic experience away from crowded Shanghai center and at the same time very well connected by metro! Will definitely recommend it for short or long stays in Shanghai!
Thanks to the beautiful landlady, in Shanghai, such an international metropolis, we have created a paradise for us. The environment here is really beautiful.

Weijie was a great host! She gave me a warm welcome, and a host of very helpful tips. The place is really lovely and located super centrally! The roof terrace/floor is particularly nice for cooking at night or simply having a few drinks. Overall, I can warmly recommend her place to anyone!
This is a comfortable home stay that is a short drive to Disney. Tracy provided easy and affordable transportation, immediate communications and great breakfasts. Highly recommended!

I was immediately stunned by the elaborate design and the amazing use of space as I walked into this Airbnb. There is everything one could ask for, and the place is close to the subway and a convenient store in a safe neighborhood. Although the place could be better cleaned and prepared for guests, the host is always responsive in dealing with issues. Overall it is a nice stay.

This is my 1st Airbnb experience in China, and it's way better than what I was expecting.

Location: It's located at the center of the city, and it only takes 3 mins to the closest subway station; you also got stores, restaurants and the BIGGEST Starbucks store of the world nearby.

House: Even though it is a tiny apartment, but the owner (also a designer), has renovated the house to a modern, spacious, and lovely place. I'm really appreciated the work the owners have put into this place.

Overall, I stayed at this place for 4 days, and it really makes me feel like I'm staying at my own place, so comfortable, and I DEFINITELY will recommend it to my friends <3
Der Aufenthalt war wirklich sehr gut und das Zimmer war sehr modern eingerichtet und sauber. Es gab nichts auszusetzen, tolle Lage. Immer wieder gerne.

Although small, the apartment is in one of the best locations in Shanghai. It__ a very short walk from a major metro station with plenty of Western and Chinese dining and shopping options. Even though it__ in a very busy area, there weren__ really any noise issues within the apartment. For a first-time visit to Shanghai, this made for an excellent home base to explore the city. The hosts were very responsive and made check in - and check out - very easy. My partner and I enjoyed the apartment and exploring the vibrant neighborhood surrounding it.

Moyan & Dailin__ place is great! The location is absolutely central - it__ less than 5 mins (slow) walk to metro West Nanjing Road. The place is small but really clean and has everything you need. Communications were very smooth too. WiFi wasn__ working at the time I was checking in but Dailin coordinated with me on the timing and sent people to fix it ASAP. I would absolutely go back to their place if I have a chance in the future.

If I could give 4.5 stars, I would. This is a very well designed apartment in a fantastic location. The apartment is in a historic building across the street from three subway lines and the world__ largest Starbucks. It is perfect for a single person or a couple. It is on the top floor, but the shower has really good water pressure. Perhaps the best part of the apartment is the screen door to the balcony, which allows you to get fresh air and see the fancy cars down on the street. Dailin and Moyan were great hosts who want you to be comfortable. I stayed more than a month, so Dailin hired cleaners each week to change the linens. I speak Chinese and was friendly with several of the neighbors, all of whom were very welcoming. The only drawbacks are that in a historic property, there can be problems with old plumbing and seasonal insects, but Dailin and Moyan are quick to help solve any problems! (Shanghai had a problem with termites this June__everal of my Chinese and foreign friends also had problems--but this wouldn__ be a problem at other times of the year. The exterminator Dailin and Moyan hired had a multi-year guarantee, so you shouldn__ have any problems.) I would recommend this place to my friends__ already have.

Moyan & Dailin's apartment is fantastic! It's compact but is so well designed that two people can easily stay there for a couple of weeks! Really well located in the heart of the city. 5 stars isn't enough for the place, the hospitality and help - definitely recommend!
I enjoyed 10 wonderful days in the appartment. Thanks for your help and quick answers in case of questions. Hope to meet again!

Lin is super good nice host. 
Place is as listed. Suitable for a big group of people staying.  A lot of beds..

The only thing is it is difficult to find. Also if scared of dog, there are quite a few dogs running around the house.

Overall,  we enjoyed our stay. Thanks Lin for having us.

It was definitely amazing experience! Strongly recommended!
Flat is fresh renovated and located in the very heart of Shanghai (Middle Huaihai Rd), easy to indulge yourself to both traditional and modern Shanghai life styles. With bus/metro downstairs you could easily go to everywhere of the city within short time.
Impeccable service from the beautiful hostess, who is a warmhearted and helpful girl with sunshine smile.

Highly recommend!! The entire house is super fancy and clean, the location is really nearby Sinan Mansion, iapm and Tianzifang. Loving the atmosphere of Former French Concession! It__ very suitable for one person or a couple! Also Bingbing is a really nice holder, love her so much! Absolutely my first choice in Shanghai next time lol!

The apartment is beautiful and the host is very helpful and friendly. I enjoyed my stay a lot.
Clean, top location and very helpful!

nice stay for a short visit of Shanghai 
The house is located in the city center, and Alice is really a nice host

This place is being taken good care of. You can see some details and thoughtful touches in the decorations and the colors. Mika was an impeccable host, being extremely responsive and helpful. 

I would definitely recommend anyone to have a pleasant stay here.
The host canceled this reservation 15 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Stylish and spacious common area. Quiet area and close to hongqiao airport and expo but far from city. Bathroom is small but bright. Some dusty counters, floor rug in bathroom doesn__ look clean with some hairs. Easy checkin but need to read instructions carefully since chinese address and taxi drivers don__ often where they are going! Overall, the place is standard but Ringko is very nice and responsive!
Good place. Comfy and pet welcome! Only 10mins drive to Hongqiao Airport.
The host canceled this reservation 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 4 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Quality and style!  Decorator touches, gourmet kitchen (albeit no dishes), spacious, fast wifi, good location -- Shopping, Metro & Restaurants within walking distance.  Beds are extra-firm but you can expect the same in most Chinese hotels.  Excellent value.
Alojamiento muy limpio, agradable y bien comunicado ( a 15' del metro).

Please inspect the room before your check in. This stay was one of my worst Airbnb experience. The mattress had multiple stains on it. There are cockroaches crawling in the kitchen sink. The bathroom faucet handle is broken. The room faces the street and there is unbearably loud construction throughout the night and early morning. Other guests come home past midnight and slam their doors closed, which is very disturbing. The host was not present during my stay and was hard to reach by phone or (Hidden by Airbnb) .
It__ great overall, such a good bargain. I love cats, but cats_ hair issue should be concerned.
enjoyed our stay, outside city near metro line 5. nice lady, very responsive.

The delicate house located in a quite community, with only a 3 mins_ walk from metro station. Many convenient stores and delicious food nearby, especially some seafood, really yummy.

_·ç was a great host.  We arrived very late in the midnight about 2am,  he wait for us and prepare early breakfast for us upon our arrival .  The next morning he sent us to Disneyland and at night pick up us from Disneyland when we call him.  Homemade breakfast also being provided. He is a very nice host and friendly. One of the best airbnb we have stayed so far. The landlord were very attentive in our needs and made sure that our stay was comfortable even though there were some language barriers. We get to experience simple but delicious breakfast that was lovingly prepared. Also included in the room package is the shuttle to and from Disneyland. Everything was great :) We recommend this place to other travelers who wants to visit Shanghai/ Shanghai Disneyland.

Overall, everything was excellent and we would stay there again.

The place is not far away from the airport and has different shopping malls and restaurants around. Nice location. The host is very helpful and nice. The room is very nice and comfortable to stay. I recommend it for people coming.

The apartment is very close to Donghua University and Metro lines 2, 3 & 4.  Xinhing Bridge Park and Hongqiao Park are close.  High quality supermarkets, Ole and City Super, are very close.  Close by is one of the best cafes in Shanghai, 2nd Cup on Ziyun Xi Lu opposite Hongqiao park.  The neighbours are very nice.  The apartment has a large fridge, washing machine, heating/aircon, bathroom with a separate shower and a stove top.  The apartment was very clean.  The apartment is very girlie with pink everywhere, but I knew that from the pictures. It didn't bother me. There are only small pots for cooking so I needed to buy a wok.  The largest towel available is a hand towel.  This was frustrating but the owner did state that in the ad so I was prepared. The apartment is on the 3rd level.  The wifi downloading is fine but uploading was very slow. The apartment is very close to the Yan'An Elevated Road and I could hear the traffic.  However, when I had the air conditioner on I could not hear the traffic.

This accommodation makes your visit in Shanghai even more special. It is extremely well equipped- there is nothing that this Airbnb does not have (Mosquito Repeller, baby bed, coffee machine, Flat screen etc.).

If you come from the airport, you can take Metro No. 2 line to get to the place directly without changing line. Highly recommend to to anyone who has a plan to Shanghai.

great location, stylish space and amazing facilities.

Loved staying at this stylish apartment. Many thoughtful touches throughout the space, especially convenient for a long term stay. Augustin was very responsive whenever I had any problems/questions. Location is fantastic - tons of restaurants and metro easily accessible.

Augustin's place has such a great location. Within easy walk of shopping, restaurants and tube line, it is a great place to be. The home was clean, well appointed and had everything you need.  Augustin was a gracious and good host, who communicated well throughout the process.

Jen__ place is as amazing as it is described on the profile! Very cozy and clean, with a lot of stylish details around. The building is a bit old but the place is brand new, the loft structure and the view from the dining place are definitely the selling points here. 
A little bit far from the metro, but gladly it__ good weather these days so good to take a walk.
Overall a wonderful experience.
The check in instructions were easy to follow. There was a lot of construction in the area, which made transportation with luggage a little challenging.

Jennifer was an awesome host! She responded to all my questions and concerns in a quick manner. In addition, she was able to provide a lot of information to me regarding traveling in Shanghai, even though she had no obligation to.

Her unit is well-designed and equipped with all the necessary amenities. Great location, short walk to convenient stores, restaurants and Starbucks coffee.

I enjoyed my stay at Jennifer's place.  It was easy to get in and out.  It was right next to Then Bund and Yu Garden.  Jennifer was helpful and came right away when I had internet connectivity issue.  Thanks!

Jennifer__ loft is absolutely amazing. A girlfriend and I made a spontaneous trip to Shanghai and chose this place for the price and location. So close to many attractions, restaurants, coffee shops and convenience stores. If I were ever to come back to Shanghai, I would definitely stay here again.

Absolutely cute place! Trust the reviews of the past residents - my stay was everything I needed for my first time in Shanghai, let alone China. The place was super quaint and cute with a really nice view at night through the window. I__ definitely stay again or recommend it to any of my friends and family if they were looking into an Airbnb to stay in for a Shanghai trip!
Jen__ apartment is super cozy, very clean and stylish. The apartment locate very close to the bund. Night view is fantastic. Very convenient area. Recommend.
Pretty close to The Bund. 5star location.

When I was reserving this house, I watched some of comments which told me this could bring us a good memory. You may take some good photos from this house but you won__ have a good experience. We were checking in after 15:30, but the bedding was not tidied yet, I sent a message to the host and she said the cleaner would be coming soon. And we waited for a while and clean came and take around 10mins to tidy. This was one of my bad experience. The second thing was the warm air was bad and we felt very cold in the house even Shanghai was in 5__. And there wasn__ enough hot water, one of us took a shower for 3mins, then suddenly changed to ice water. I contacted the host and she asked me to wait for another 30-40mins. 
And we could clearly hear the loud from outsider and next door. Pay-TV is needed, no public and free channel. 
Is this worth for RMB$650 a night? Think about it.

Jennifer's place was pretty large and we liked the shower + dining area -- great for working during the day with lots of natural light. However, the location is about 15 mins walk to the "fun" stuff, at least from a tourist perspective. The building is also quite old, but indeed the apartment interior is brand new. Some noise from neighbors, otherwise peaceful, can't hear any street noise.

Jennifer indeed is a super host! I had a wonderful stay in Jennifer__ apartment. I received very clear instructions how to get to the apartment, and tips around the building where is the subway station....
The apartment inside is very stylish, even though building outside looks a little rundown, but once you get into the apartment, I felt relaxed. Especially having a cup of coffee in the dining table with skyscrapers view is super nice!!

It was a good stay. I really liked the area near the window with sunlight. There are plenty of mirror in the room which made this room seems more spaceful, although I was expecting the room to be a bit bigger.
It located in good location, but not so close to the subway station. 
The room and the apartment building are not as new as it seem. Especially the elevator hall, it was quite dirty.
Sound proof was very bad. I was wokr up by a noise neighbour who was playing some music at 6:30am.... I had to knock on her door to stop the noise. 
The apartment was equipped with all necessary amenities, but like the room itself they were bit old.. The air-conditioner was dusty and making weird sound.. 
The last let down was the view. I chose this apartment mostly because I liked the window seat and the view (I was expecting a nice view). But it was quite a shocker when I open the curtains... It faced right to a half abandoned parking lot...

I was worried I would not be able to make it around very easily but Jennifer was able to respond quickly and send me the address so I was able to quickly copy and past the address. Even better the stay was amazing and sparkling clean! I can not wait to come back in the future.

I am highly impressed and overwhelmed by the friendliness of Helen and Zheng. They have offered me not just a room but a home for now 1 month and I will stay another one in their home. The room is very clean and offers everything and more than I could need. Helen is a great cook and they invited me to eat with them quite often. I would even say we became friends. When I arrived in China because of my businesstrip I did not know anyone except of my colleagues, so she asked me if I wanted to play ping pong with her and her friends.
Sometimes we sit together in the evening and teach each other languages (chinese, german, english) it is always funny. 
I can only recommend this air bnb room. If you want privacy you get it and if you are a open minded communicative person you can have people to talk to. I am very glad that I found this room.

After 2 months in Helen and Zheng's appartement, i can truly say that the accommodation and is absolutely beautiful and clean and the hosts are very kind.

 I had a clean room,a comfortable big bed and enough space to storage my clothes and goods.

The kitchen is well equiped so I could cook by myself or together with my hosts.

We had a close relationship during my stay. Spend the weekends together, playing ping pong and singing karaoke.

Helen cooked nearly every evening and as she and her husband are very good in cooking, I enjoyed every meal. Sometimes even finger licking.

I am very glad that I had the chance to live here, because I did not only find a room, but a home in china.
The room is new and same as photo shown. Easy to check-in. Facilities are good. Host is helpful with quick response. Not far either from Line 2 or Line 4. Supermarket is nearby.

Overall not bad - you get what you pay for.

Convenience, near by few shopping malls (Wan Da, Metro), and plenty of restaurant, around 1.8KM from the MRT station (Song Jiang University station).  Host is responsive when I facing problem, and allow me to check in early.

Firstly, Anna is a wonderful host, she guided me all the way until the end of the trip. Secondly, the apartment was quite gorgeous, it__ just one of those places that looks exactly the same as in the pictures. We would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Shanghai!

A great lovely escape from the busyness of Shanghai in the best part, close to great restaurants and easy transport. The host was extremely understanding and accommodating and the view from the room is one of the best hidden gyms in the city :)

Great location with bars, restaurants and convenient store just around the corner. Superb host, very responsive and helpful. Check-in was smooth and the apartment is easy to find. great location and hospitality. the host is kind enough to arrange someone to help me with luggage as i__ pregnant. the studio is pretty cold at first, but with air conditioner, it__ getting more comfortable. anyhow, good stay with good host and great location.

I will definitely come back here! Thanks!
The place was nice and comfortable. Enjoyed it. I will stay again if I have a chance.

Arvin & Elena's place is comfortable and clean.  The people who are around due to the school next door are friendly and helpful.  Arvin was gracious and flexible.  I had an enjoyable stay here and highly recommend this place.

This is a lovely and quiet room located in a pleasent neighborhood. In a busy city like Shanghai it was a pleasure staying in this place, with trees in the windows. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
A very convenient place, everything was really close to the flat.  Arvin was a very kind host and soonest to reply all questions.

Let__ start with the landscape from the room. When you enter the apartment, the first thing you see is this amazing landscape of Pudong side through balcony, exactly like what you see in the picture. What you don__ see from the picture is that the landscape changes per time, per weather, etc. and all and each of them are AMAZINGLY BEAUTIFUL! The view from this apartment is A++ level.

Location-wise, it is located literally just a tunnel away from the Bund. Even with rush-hour traffic, 10minutes by taxi. Usually 5-7minutes. Right in front of the apartment is W hotel, which, apparently is newly built recently, not so many people around. That means, it is very quiet at night, perfectly peaceful for your bedtime after a long day of city tour.

Facility-wise, the building itself seems a bit aged but the apartment itself is renovated in a modern way, with a built-in projector, which you can use to watch TV or movies in the system. Everything in the house is very clean and well organized, easy to find anything you need for your stay.

Greeny was an extremely warm and kind host, answered any of my questions in no more than a few minutes. 

If you are visiting Shanghai with your beloved ones, this is one of the coziest, pretties place to consider.

Greeny__ place is amazing! Great view, well designed, just like the pictures. The subway is close by and you can access a lot of the city from there, whereas the bund is a simple walk away. Great for a few days stay.
i had to message the host to get the code to get in, appart from that everything was great. The view is incredible!

Recommend.
The room is clean with a king size bed. All supplies are provided including a projector, air-conditioner, etc.
The view is fine. ( Can__ see the river clearly since it__ on the ninth floor instead of top floors)
We love the kitchen! Family members sit together and enjoy self-cooked meal. 
Lovely and cozy place.

I stayed at this lovely residence from July 24th - August 1st.... Greeny was lovely with the communication about where to find the place, Wi-Fi password, hidden key etc. 
As for the place itself.... it is in an older building adjacent to the W Hotel and a fancy smancy mall and within a two - five minute walk from International Cruise Terminal Station on Line 10 (about 45 minutes from Hongqaio Airport and about the same to Pudong Airport).... The interior was very modern and it has Western Amenities such as a Western toilet (w/ washlet) and a updated shower. The room has a outrageously beautiful balcony that overlooks the Pudong Financial District in front of you while the Bund will be on the right side. Not only is it easy to access the metro to anywhere in the city there but also you can take a 15 minute walk to the Bund and sightsee or another 20 minute walk to see the SNH48 Theater. There are a couple of convenience stores within 2 minutes and the the Wi-Fi was strong as well. As of the time of this writing, they are doing construction on the room next door so you might get some clanging and banging but if you leave early and come back late, you won't notice a thing. Anyways, it was a great place to stay and I can't wait to make a return trip!
Very clean, thoughtfully designed place right next to the subway station. Amazing view of the skyline from the balcony. Greeny is *very* quick to respond, would highly recommend staying here.

Good location, great view and very nice decoration. The flat is described as a 3-person flat. But it__ not possible as there is only one bed and the bed linen is rather small even for 2 people. The 3rd person had to take an hotel. Unfortunately, if you look in details, there are many problems : one table is broken, the kitchen and the bathroom are not correctly clean, glasses were dirty and no cutlery. 
I would not recommend as there are great hotel rooms for 35$ in the Center of Shanghai. You won__ have the view, but it will be clean and convenient.
The place was dirty. Black mold was in the bathroom. Towels had disgusting yellow spots. The building is old if it matters. The view from the room was nice, but overall it__ not worth it all.

Amazing place!! It's in the center of center of center of Shanghai, near subway, Xintiandi, but still with the locals. The neighbors are quite nice, clean and quiet. You don't need any intro of the city, because you walk out is already Danshui Road, lots of hidden gems on this street. 

C has super taste. The place is very clean, comfortable, and everything made sense. I can't say more good things about the place coz I can go on and on. Haha.

Mumu__ place was in a very convenient location in Shanghai. However we did not enjoy our stay  due to poor communication and general condition of the accommodation. We were not advised that we had to register our stay with the Chinese police which led to delays at the airport customs. The bathroom had poor ventilation and mould on the walls and bathroom slippers.

My friends and I spent 3 nights at the property and here are some honest comments from us.

Overall
-the apartment was conveniently located within 5-10min from the MTR station and it looked exactly as the pictures shown; however, it was poorly maintained and there__ definitely a lot of room for improvement regarding its cleanliness.

Cleanliness
-strong moldy scent upon our arrival, even with the air-conditioning on
-the bathroom and bean bags in the living room had visible molds on them
-one of the blankets had blood stain on it (which we later found that this had already been mentioned in another review back in Feb (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , meaning the blanket had not been washed since then!)
-fridge was not plugged in and smelled disgusting
-walls were stained as well

Facilities
-steamer was dusty af, not sure if it had ever been used (or cleaned)
-low water pressure as expected, but the water pipe broke during our stay and the water heater got cut off, which one of my friend had to shower in freezing cold water in the middle of the night
-thin walls, we had no problem listening to the TV next door or our upstairs neighbor
-VERY STEEP STAIRS!

Host
-friendly and easy to reach through (Hidden by Airbnb) 
-responded very quickly to all our queries
-less proactive in suggesting attractions or restaurants nearby
-user manuals of the appliances were only sent as per request

Final verdict
-as an airbnb plus property, its standard is definitely not up to par
-not worth the money

The room is very close to the subway station, and there are supermarkets and cafes downstairs, you can reach the high street and shopping centres in just 5 minutes. The two toilets in the house are clean and tidy, with 24 hours provided hot water . There is also a large balcony, can be used to place clothing that needs to be dried. Good value if you don't wanna stay in an expensive hotel.  Nice,  clean and neat room.  Very tidy and quiet.  Although bathroom can be a little dirty from time to time. Location is also good. That says all, Miya__ place is centrally located in the heart of Shanghai, close to the French Concession, 50 meters to the Metro station, tons of good restaurants within walking distance, convenient store right down the building.  The apartment itself is very modern and clean, will definitely stay here again, next time when I__ in town.

Me encanto hosperme en este alojamiento, fue una buena experiencia , muy buenos chicos, gracias por todo , son personas geniales
This is a very convenient place and cheap very well located closed to the train station. Perfect for 1 to 2 nights.

Very good value for money. Stayed here for a couple of nights on super quick notice (literally booked it as soon as I landed at Pudong). There is a bus for Â¥22 that takes you to Shanghai Railway, which is a few mins walk from the house. The host was very accommodating as well. Perfect for a short stay
Nice location, safe area, lot of restautants, reasonable price for a few days stay, but the room is totally different from the pictures
The host canceled this reservation 62 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
It was easy to get from the airport and back! Super convenient and had lots of shops around .
Great apartment.  Great location.  Very clean.

I liked apartment very much! Good location, a few stops by bus or subway to city center. The area is calm , not noisy. There are few convenience stores and fruit shops nearby. The apartment located on 6 floor with no elevator but for me was no problem, is very clean and spacious, with fast wifi connection. The host is nice, she speak English well and replies to messages fast. I enjoyed my stay !
Great place to stay in Pudong
Die Unterkunft hat eine super Lage, nur 2 Metro Stationen vom Zentrum entfernt . Dan war immer erreichbar wenn irgendwas war und sie war super hilfsbereit .
Residential area so very peaceful and everything you need in walking distance. Apartment is shared with 3 others so athmosphere depends on them. All rooms are lockable, private rooms are very clean.

The apartment is really close to metro station on line 9. And it's only 1 station to Century Avenue, then you can get your way on every destination very easily. Bathroom isn't the clearest. But well enough and it costs how it costs. Thank you!
The host canceled this reservation 14 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The place was nice and in a good location in Yangpu. He host was very attentive and would recommended him.
Amazing stay, ___ is a very kind and hospitable host. He checked on us constantly to see if we were able to reach place. Location was great, big place and clean. Recommended. Thanks ___ï½

this apartment is great, near a useful metro station, a big space, the landlord goes through just to go upstairs. 
very clean, very safe, the only problem is the dogs next door. if you want to sleep late the dogs next door and the activity center downstairs are not quiet. otherwise a great place. landlord is fantastic, 6th floor with no elevator to keep you warm on the way up in the winter months.

this is definitely my best airbnb experience so far. i don't really need to explain anything, all i can say is: this is your home in shenzhen. you don't have to look for any other listing. this is like staying at a five star hotel. Location is too good to be true, comunication was flawless. Thank u host we will definitely come back in the future

the place was quite big and equipped with a lot of amenities. It is very pitful that the kitchen's stuff was to clean thourughly before to use, the air conditionner too is to clean . The host was very helpful for the check in and promptly replied to every message I sent him. Except for the cleaniless, everything was alright.
The surrounding is amazing. Public transport nearby. All can be access by walking distance.

We had a great time at this place. Beautifully furnished space with the heart of busy Shanghai. Great surroundings and a good vantage point to see the city's skyline. Literally a walk away from the nearest subway station and from Nanjing Road. Supermarkets and fruit shops close by. And a great selection of Chinese as well as Western restaurants nearby. Kitchen needs to be equipped though. But if you are planning to eat out during your stay, it should not be a problem. Overall, would highly recommend staying at Justin's.

Beautiful place. It__ not always easy to find a peaceful , well accommodated house in China but this place is perfect for weekend get-always from Shanghai. The host speaks great English and will answer all your questions via (Hidden by Airbnb) . The two owners of the place live next door (attached to the house) are really nice! The lady made us delicious dumplings and soup to welcome us, and her husband drove us to the supermarket to buy supplies for the bbq. The kitchen is very well equipped, everything is there (even an oven). The rooms are really nice and the bathrooms are modern, everything was very clean. There was also a pool (but it was too cold for us to use it) and a large outdoor area. The only negative point we had was that it wasn__ entirely private. Locals were able to use our garden which made a few tenants uncomfortable since we were in our bikinis so we got a few looks.

This is my first Airbnb stay and it was simply awesome. Host was super responsive and provided ample useful info before check in. The place is amazing  and felt like we are no longer in Shanghai. Modern, well maintained, smartly designed, the place is outstanding in many ways. We love the cost outdoor pool the most. Both caretakers were very nice and polite and non-intrusive. Super value for money and will definitely be back. I would recommend this to anyone in a heartbeat. 

If there's one suggestion, maybe a slightly bigger BBQ pit will be the icing of a great home stay.

We had a great time in this Airbnb. The communication was super easy and quick and the place looks even better than on the pictures. This house is a quiet, clean,  spacious and calming place. It was a perfect spot for a stay with friends. Would absolutely recommend to stay there!
The house is nice, clean and very comfortable. We enjoyed our stay very much.
Brilliant place and stay, will be back in summer time.
excelente ubicacion,el apartamento es muy bonito y aseo impecable . lo recomiendo, volveria a alojarme en el cuando vuelva a shanghai .
Awesome place for staying in Shanghai
Impecable apartment. With good services and very confortable

Leimin was an amazing host, she provided pick up from the airport as well as drop off which was super helpful because it can be tricky using the local ride sharing apps.

Her home was spacious and very clean, much cleaner and more comfortable than I was expecting. It was the perfect distance from Pudong airport for a long layover.

The only slight drawback is that you will have to get a ride to the local restaurants or stores.

Overall I really enjoyed my stay with Leimin, a great host and a great room.

P.S. Internet services are different from the rest of the world so if you are having trouble accessing services like (Hidden by Airbnb) or (Hidden by Airbnb) then you may want to ask Leimin about this.
The host canceled this reservation 18 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Very nice room, clean and plenty of space. Highly recommended if you are going to the airport or Disneyland. Located outside the city, but the host was very nice and picked us up at the subway station and drove us to the airport in the morning for free. He also helped us find a place to eat and drove us there too.

Great hospitality and response times, very helpful

This was an amazing air bnb home. The home was very clean, big, and nice! The family is very friendly and helpful, I enjoyed them a lot! The location is good if you want you be near the airport. It__ close to Pudong Airport and about a 5 minute drive to the Metro station which can take you downtown. I highly recommend this place!!

It is a very comfortable room. I had a good rest and enjoyed my own shower. Leimin replied to my messages instantly and her dad is the sweetest. He picked and dropped me off everywhere and took me to the airport at 1am. They are very kind and went out of their way to ensure that I was comfortable.
Even though Liemin's place is a little bit far from public transportation her father and herself give rides back and forth

Leimin has a lovely home. It was a great place to stay during our layover. Leimin was very helpful with lots of great tips and detailed messages. We did not get to meet Leimin since she was out of the country at that time. she was very pleasant over messages I would have loved to meet her. The stay was about a 10 min drive to airport and her father picked us up and drove us back to airport in the morning. Her father is a very kind and attentive gentleman. We really enjoyed our stay at there home.
The host were super sweet and accommodating. Picked me up and dropped me off at the airport. The interaction  was super smooth. Thank you for everything.
This is the perfect place for a quick layover at Shanghai airport. Very clean and has a fantastic shower for the tired traveler.

Leimins Dad picked us up and dropped us off at the airport he also took us to the metro station and picked us up from there too. Communication with him was a little difficult as he doesn__ speak English but (Hidden by Airbnb) translate and keeping in contact with Leimin helped us a lot. The bed is firm if you don__ mind that everything you need for a short layover

The apartment of Lisa is a special place, charming and comfortable. 
 Lisa is a very careful landlady. She provided towels and  double bed sheets for every bed as well as Italian cafe and cafe-machine and some cookies as welcome.
The apartment is located in an elegant and calm area but close to shops (also international market), restaurants and bar. It is quite spacious, very well mantained and clean. The furnitures are a mixture of IKEA and traditional style and there is plenty of room for clothes, shoes etc. There is also a piano! 
The bathroom is very large with bath tube and washing machine. The shower works quite well and hot water is always available.
The kitchen is very well equipped, I prepared the food myself almost every day! 
Also the single bed room (without window) is a cosy and comfortable room. I shared the apartment with a colleague for 1 full months and we never got in trouble for lack of privacy or unbalanced confort.
Finally the entrance hall and stairs are in good state and clean, and this is not easy to find in Shanghai.

We loved it. The apartment is very clean, it has a stylish decoration with a cosy touch, it's not super big but it's good enough for 2-3 people to stay. It is well located, pretty much in the heart of the former french concession. The host is amazing (both Lisa and her uncle), really helpful and welcoming. We stayed for almost 3 months and Lisa was always replying fast and helping us with any arrangements. There are nice areas to walk around and good restaurants to visit. Lisa's place is totally recommended and we would love to stay again!
I have great experience to live there. the place is super nice, convenient and quite. the host is extremely kind and helpful.

Spent 2 wonderful nights here. The house belongs to a heritage architecture and I really appreciate the interior decorations done by the host. Really worth a stay if you wanna live locally in the old town of Shanghai.

The house are very clean and tidy. It__ just a few minutes walk from Xintiandi station. Last but not least, Daphne and her husband are kind and friendly.
The accommodation was actually even better than I expected. Daphne was so nice and I really enjoy the stay. Definitely recommend!
Located in the heard of the best part of the city.  Elegant and clean apartment. Cozy guest room full of sunshine though a bit small. Last but not least - a very nice couple of hosts.

This airbnb is a boutique hotel. So you check in like a normal hotel. We had a little difficulty getting our taxi to find the place. But it was clean and open! The hosts didn__ speak any English, even though they responded to our initial messages in English. 

The beds were pretty hard And the bathroom was a curtained off area. But it was clean and private! We only stayed for one night. This was the 4th Airbnb we had to get for the one night. There was apparently some local government issue with foreign guests staying at Airbnbs that were not approved for foreign guests. So we were lucky to get any accommodations in our budget. 

A quick drive to Disney and the hosts drove us for no extra fees!
The host canceled this reservation 3 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Jun helped us very well with the checkin, also for western people no problem to find everything. The loft is not in the city center (obviously) but very close to the subway, shopping center, restaurants and some supermarkets. We enjoyed our stay very much and we can recommand Jun and her loft for 100 percent!

Jun is an wonderful host. She can speak English and that__ a plus point if you cannot speak Mandarin. House is clean and shiny. Lots of sunlight coming up. There are restaurant and shopping mall just around the building. I feel homely to stay at her place. Only disadvantage of this place is- its very faraway from the central point of Shanghai. It took more than an hour by metro to get the city centre.
The host canceled this reservation 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

The apartment is very clean and comfortable, nicely decorated (photos are very accurate), plenty of natural light streaming into the living room and bedroom ... very comfortable bed too!
The only downside, if any, is that the sound insulation between neighbouring apartments and between floors, isn__ ideal. Apart from that, everything else is great! 
è® is very accommodating and quick in his replies to any questions/issues.
Clean, spacious, plenty of natural light. Very comfortable bed!
It's in a serviced apartment. Very clean and comfortable space.
The host canceled this reservation 18 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

It was a great stay at Candice's place. This cozy apartment is near subway station. Newly renovated with stylish decoration. You can find all you need for daily life, can wash clothes and a big laundry rack plus washing powder is povided as well. Bed is big enough and there is a soda bed too, matress is comfortable. 
Candice is very nice and easy to communicate, promptly response.
All in all, highly recommend.
A very clean and quiet apartment in a very convenient location.  The Auchan nearby and the convenient access to Line 8 and many bus routes made getting around easy.
Good location, good owner almost perfect
I arrived around 1 am, they were able to check me in. good
Very cute and private spot in the best part of SH!!
Very well located. Be aware of the type of accommodation

Very cozy place in the heart of Shanghai, perfect for solo or couple travelers. Hard to beat in terms of location (bars/restaurants/nightlife/access to Metro Line 2 for airport) and price performance. Fiona the host gave good, specific directions to find the place and check-in, and was very attentive to our needs.
Fiona__ place was in a quiet, very convenient location. lots of local restaurants and things to see. Fiona was great with communication and helped me check in no problem.

Pros:
Fiona is super friendly and responsive. The interior of the apartment looks just as pictured.The location is perfect Fumin Lu is awesome -  walking distance to like 3 different metros and the neighborhood is super cute too with tons of food and shops that stay open late.

Cons:
The apartment building is a bit jarring you walk into what looks like a shared kitchen that hasn't really been cleaned - before you actually enter Fiona's apartment unit. You can hear everything your neighbors are doing and although the apartment was clean there was a bug problem in the bathroom(I think due to plumbing).

If you are tall, this place is not right for you. As a 180cm+ male, I had to hunch/crouch to access the second floor bedroom. the showerhead went up to my nose. The toilet seat felt cramped due to poor overall design. Basically an unextremely unpleasant experience

Host is responsive but unsympathetic and like to dodge the issue. Was locked out by the communal security door at 11:20pm in a dark alleyway. The promised key and even the spare was not in the predetermined spots. Was a very shit experience, and I indicated many times to the host that I felt unsafe. After getting access at around midnight, I confronted her about it and she dodged the issue for a while. Next time check that everything you say is there, IS THERE

Found a bug on the left hand side of bathroom sink, and surprise, another underneath my pillow. Great experience 

Only good thing about the place is location. Very close to everything.
Fiona was quick to respond, apartment was located quite centrally within walking distance of a lot of restaurants, bars and supermarkets.

The host is extremely nice! 

The place itself is tiny though, only suitable for those light traveler who only has one mini suitcase, and not too tall!

Sleek and minimalist design, both interior and exterior, and the hotel as a whole really stood out from the other surrounding buildings. Host and staffs were friendly and will go out of their way to find the best route to your destination. Other than that, I really like that dorms are separated by gender by default because the last capsule hotel i stayed (in Malaysia) you'll have to pay an additional fee to have an all girls room. Ive been to Shanghai a few times and I'd say this would be the most valued for money location, the train station is also only a walk away and this is just three stops away from nanjing road where i did most of my shoppings. The capsules were very clean and tidy and daily essentials were provided. Overall I'd give it a 5 stars cause of the brilliant hospitality and design. Would definitely want to go back again.

The staff members at Weflow were professional and accommodating from beginning to end. They quickly responded to my queries before I arrived and kindly helped me with all my needs during my visit. The facility was kept immensely clean and I felt very safe in the hostel and in the surrounding neighborhood (make sure to wander about the neighborhood to find many gems such as large indoor markets with delicious food stands and the international tea culture square. In fact, I spent more time in that neighborhood than any other single area). It's only 3 stops from the heart of downtown and a 5 minute walk to the Metro. I will absolutely stay here if I ever come back to Shanghai.
This place is absolutely wonderful. I would stay here any time.
The place is extremely stylish and clean, just like the photos! Also located really near the metro so that makes traveling very convenient
With the price as such, one could find a hostel in a more central and culturally enriched area. The communication with staff and solutions could also have been more honest and straightforward.
Good & friendly host. Highly recommend here.
stylish place. 8min from metro. very nice host!
Kristy is a responsive host and renders her assistance during our stay. She is a very kind and sweet host.

Would definitely recommend this Airbnb! Great location, 10 minute walk from People's Square and a few minutes walk from restaurants! Kristy is also very quick and prompt with responses - there was an issue with the door and Kristy fixed it straight away!

Kristy has been an amazing host. She was extremely responsive to my needs especially when I was locked out of the flat, making sure I regained access quickly.

This opportunity to live in an original vintage style part of Shanghai but with modern amenities has been incredible. 

Be warned the stairs are a little vintage and narrow as well, pack light where possible. 
The area was safe, convenient and quiet at the same time. Neighbours were friendly and helpful. The flat has natural lighting which makes getting up more comfortable. 

Perfect for one to two person stay.
very cozy little loft. nice and clean

Kristy and her boyfriend who helped us check in after being unable to find the place despite instructions were nice.
The place however, does not look like the images, the surrounding area and staircase leading up to the apartment were dilapidated and a safety hazard. This place was not for us and I__ request surrounding area pictures, up-to-date apartment images and staircase images and proof of working safety features in the building itself not just the apartment (fire alarm, carbon monoxide detector, etc. etc.) before staying here. I understand wear and tear are inevitable, but this was not just wear and tear it was stained carpets, burned hallway walls and a very less than ideal surrounding area. This place wasn__ for us and we left as soon as we could and booked a hotel and immediately took a taxi to the downtown area.

The host was very helpful, even assisted me with (Hidden by Airbnb) /phone payment issues I was having. The bedroom (duplex part) was dark and quiet, and the bed linen were excellent (high thread count), excellent if you expect/have a jetlag.

The apartment is the top floor of an old Shanghai-style house. So yes, that means climbing some stairs. But that also gives you the Shanghai-experience. And there are no people cooking in the staircases (that does happen in some Shanghainese houses).

Location-wise the apartment is very well situated. Walking distance to People's Square, and from there you can take subways everywhere. Taxi (and Didi) drivers can also easily find the right intersection, and I've also biked to some locations and went to Suzhou river for a run.

Internet, laundry machine and TV (I connected my laptop with my own HDMI cable) also worked perfect.

The room and location are very respectable. Be ready for some local interactions and and experiences; an older couple lives on the second floor. Personally, I asked to check in at an earlier time and it seemed like the cleaning person was rushed. I had to vacuum the area myself. The host was receptacle to advice, and I hope your experience is a little better.

Everything you need and nothing you don't in a classic Shikumen building.

Really charming renovation of the apartment: makes it light and airy.  Washing machine was a plus.  Convenient to anywhere around People's Park or Nanjing Rd.

Awesome little loft located short walk from People__ Square metro station and great restaurants as well as museums. Additionally, only a couple stops away from Shanghai Railway Station so super convenient. Stairs up to apartment are a bit small and old so try not to overpack!
What you see is what you get! Nice and cozy place to stay! Clean and tidy!

Excellent location! People Square and Subway Stations are very close. You can basically walk 5-10 minutes to various Museums, Malls, Nanjing Road, Restaurants, etc. Great host. Responds quickly to your messages. The apartment is exactly what you see in the photos. A little small, but perfect for a short stay. Highly recommended!!!

The location is great.  Major attraction, such as Shanghai Museum, People's Square, Shanghai Urban Planning Museum, etc. are all in short walking distance.  The metro is also nearby that takes you to The Bund, Pudong Financial District, Yunnan Garden, Jinan Temple, etc.  Like you see in the photo, the place is simple and basic, and a perfect space for single, or couple accomodation.  It's on the top floor and the common staircase is narrow with no elavator.  During my 4 nights stay, I found it relatively quiet at night, but in the morning, it gets a bit noisy due to workers outside working on renovation next door.

The interior was cozy but the external environment of the area was not very pleasant, especially the staircase was narrow and dirty. Some renovation works were carried out at the staircase since the first day of my vacation starting at 6 am !! It was noisy and messy, and disturbing. TV was not connected to antenna so you could not watch any TV broadcasts. Yes, you could use the internet services but many of them require your subscriptions. The sleeping corner (upper deck) was hot as the cold air from air-conditioner could not reach it (it's simple physics, cold air tends to go down rather than go up). They should have provided a fan at the upper deck for better circulation. I also found some bedsheets were left in the washing machine. By the way, no cloth hangers were provided.

Kristy's place was our first accommodation during our first trip to China. I have to say that after finding the correct building and entering the narrow staircase, you might be taken aback a little. The apartment is situated in an old historical building and during our stay, large construction works were underway.  Having entered the apartment, everything was as pictured in the listing (i.e. the apartment is fully renovated) , although accompanied with some dust from the construction works. Which is understandable. The bed was comfortable and clean. The same goes for the bathroom and towels. 

I would recommend Kristy's place if you are in search for a very authentic living experience in Shanghai. This place might not be for everyone, but we really grew into it over the course of our stay and are very happy we could experience living like a Shanghai local.

Kristy and her husband were very helpful and responded to our messaged quickly.

Excellent location - walking distance to the famous nanjing shopping strip, and close to the foreigner-friendly stores around west nanjing road. Loft is in the top floor of a old-style building (very nostalgic to me). Inside is very modern, but be prepared as the outside is very much not so (I.e. outdoor washing areas, smells..). Great if you want to experience a bit of old Shanghai in a central city location.

Kristy and her place are great. She was available when I asked for something and her clean, stylish apartment was in an excellent location. I have to go to Shanghai  about once a month and I hope to stay a Kristy's from now on since it is so reasonable and nice.
The bed is really comfortable, the interior is more modern than the exterior, in one of the old buildings of Shangai. The service was good.
Ideal for a trip to Shanghai, really central and close to People__ Square. Nice private space, ideal for a couple!

The place was as advertised.
Easy communication.
Had a great stay! Recommended!
Super nice host, the place is cool, and the location is super! 100% recommended!

The owner is a nice person, but the housing is dirty.  The sofa and carpet were very dirty, the dishes were dirty, there was no toilet paper, the toilet seat was not fixed to the toilet, water was flowing under the sink, and there was always a puddle on the floor.  Dumplings remained in the refrigerator after the last guest.  BUT The second floor, where my wife and I really liked the bedroom, there is a very comfortable bed with an excellent mattress and a roof window that creates an atmosphere at night and in the morning.
